input: Which of the following statements is not correct?

options.A: In Lok Sabha, a no-confidence motion has to set out the grounds on which it is based.
options.B: In the case of a no-confidence motion in Lok Sabha, no conditions of admissibility have been laid down in the rules.
options.C: A motion of no-confidence once admitted has to be taken up within ten days of leave being granted.
options.D: Rajya Sabha is not empowered to entertain a motion of no- confidence.

explanation: ‘No-confidence motion’ need not state the reason for it being adopted in the Lok Sabha
